A male Japanese [[Amatsuki (utaite)|singer]], voice actor, [[virtual YouTuber]], and member of the Japanese esports organization [[Crazy Raccoon]].

His default outfit consists of a [[white shirt]] worn over a [[black sweater|black]] [[turtleneck sweater]] and containing his artist logo (the letter "A" enclosed in a crescent moon), [[black pants]], [[white jacket]], [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]], [[orange belt]], and a gold [[necklace]].

title: waffle_house
body:
[b]Waffle House[/b] is an American restaurant chain that is open 24 hours everyday that serves [[Waffle]]s, Southern style breakfast food and sandwiches. While the restaurant is famous for its food, it is also infamous for fights involving drunk customers or the staff.  

The restaurant chain is also known for their disaster preparedness and ability to return to operations quickly after an extreme weather event has hit an area.  This has resulted in an unofficial index called the Waffle House Index, an index that measures of how impactful an extreme weather event is based on how badly the event has impacted the operations of Waffle Houses in an area.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Waffle House":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waffle_House]

title: ao_nhat_binh
body:
Áo Nhật Bình is a royal attire of the Nguyen dynasty from 1807 during the Gia Long era until the end of the Nguyen dynasty. The common design often include the rectangle-shaped collar in front of the wearer which was why it was being called as Nhật Bình.

title: fern_(sousou_no_frieren)
body:
The deuteragonist from [[Sousou no Frieren]]. Fern was an orphan adopted and raised by [[Heiter]], and is the young mage apprentice of [[Frieren]], accompanying her as a member of her party. She has a habit of [[pout]]ing when she is [[angry]].

Fern is a young human teen/adult with [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long waist-length]] [[purple hair]], styled with a [[straight hair|straight cut]] and [[blunt bangs]]. She usually wears her hair down with two additional [[sidelocks|chest-length strands]] framing her face. After her sixteenth birthday, Fern began styling her hair partially tied back with a [[butterfly hair ornament]] gifted by Frieren.

During her travels with Frieren, she is most commonly seen wearing a [[long dress|long]], [[buttons|buttoned]] [[white dress]] with a Victorian-style top, including a [[frilled collar]] and [[long sleeves]], along with [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. When outdoors, she also dons a [[long coat|long]] [[hooded coat]] [[black coat]] with a white inside layer. For her eighteenth birthday, [[Stark (sousou no frieren)|]] gave her an ornate mirrored lotus [[bracelet]] as a present, which she frequently wears on her left wrist.

After the events at [[granat (sousou no frieren)|Graf Granat's]] Domain, Graf Granat gave Fern a [[black dress|black]], [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[dress]] that she wears with a thick, [[white coat|white]] [[winter coat]] and [[purple scarf|purple]] [[braided scarf]] in colder settings.

h4. Official art

* !post #7397165: [[Fern (Sousou No Frieren)|Default]]
* !post #7397175: [[Fern (Sousou No Frieren)|Default (Reference)]]

title: ahnenerbe_shop_uniform
body:
The uniform worn by waiters and waitresses at the Ahnenerbe coffee shop in the metaverse created by Kinoko Nasu of [[Type-Moon]] fame (including series like [[Fate (series)|]], [[Kara no Kyoukai]]. [[Mahou Tsukai no Yoru]], [[Mahou Tsukai no Hako]], [[Tsukihime]], [[Carnival Phantasm]] and others). Ahnenerbe is actually a Magician's Box created by [[Kischur Zelretch Schweinorg]] that connect parallel worlds together so characters from different series can interact with each other.

Post #3923017 shows the uniform for both men and women. The female uniform has different colored aprons depending on the character.

The term [i]ahnenerbe[/i] means "heritage" in German.

title: help:bur_notice
body:
A [b]bulk update request[/b] (BUR) is a request to change one or more tags. Creating a bulk update request will create a forum topic to discuss and vote on the request.

Use the format below to make a request:

[code]
alias bunny_tail -> rabbit_tail
unalias bunny_tail -> rabbit_tail

imply rabbit_tail -> tail
unimply rabbit_tail -> tail

rename bunny_tail -> rabbit_tail

update bunny solo no_humans -> animal_focus

deprecate orange
undeprecate orange

nuke bunny

category touhou -> copyright
[/code]

[b]Alias[/b] merges two tags, making the first tag a synonym for the second tag. Aliasing [[bunny tail]] to [[rabbit tail]] moves all [[bunny tail]] posts to [[rabbit tail]], and redirects all searches for [[bunny tail]] to [[rabbit tail]].

[b]Imply[/b] makes the first tag automatically add the second tag. Implying [[bunny tail]] to [[tail]] means all [[bunny tail]] posts are automatically tagged with the [[tail]] tag.

[b]Rename[/b] renames a tag without making it a permanent alias. Renaming [[bunny tail]] to [[rabbit tail]] moves all [[bunny tail]] posts to [[rabbit tail]], but doesn't redirect searches for [[bunny tail]] to [[rabbit tail]]. Most tag moves should be aliases, not renames. Renames are for when a permanent alias would be undesirable. Tags with more than 200 posts can't be renamed, they must be aliased.

[b]Update[/b] does a mass search and add. The tags on the left are searched and the tags on the right are added to all matching posts. Tags can also be removed by prepending [code]-[/code] to the tag on the right.

[b]Deprecate[/b] locks the tag so it can't be added to posts. [b]Undeprecate[/b] reverts this.

[b]Nuke[/b] removes a tag or pool.

[b]Category[/b] changes the tag to an artist, copyright, character, general, or meta tag. It can be used to propose changing the category of a tag with many posts that "you cannot do yourself":[/wiki_pages/help:tags#dtext-changing-tag-categories], or to change the tag category after other types of changes are made.

title: stargate_sg-1
body:
An American-Canadian [[military]] [[science fiction]] television show running from 1997-2007, based on the 1994 film [i]Stargate[/i].

The show is based around the titular [i]Stargate[/i], ancient alien devices located throughout the galaxy that can open up wormholes allowing travel from one to another. The show follows the adventures of SG-1, the main team of a secret military organization tasked with exploring new worlds and battling interstellar threats.

The series has inspired two spinoff series and several movies.

h4. Tagged characters

* [[Daniel Jackson]]
* [[Jack O'neill]]
* [[Samantha Carter]]
* [[Teal'c]]

h4. See also

title: scharlachrot
body:
[b]Scharlachrot[/b] (シャルラッハロート / Sharurahharōto) is a character from [[Arcana Heart 3]], an all-girl 2D fighting game.

* Country: Japan
* Location: Rosenberg, school dormitories, Sagamihara, Kanagawa
* Date of Birth: Unknown
* Height: 158 cm
* Weight: 47 kg
* Three sizes: 81/56/82
* Blood type: AB type
* Affiliation: Group A Junior High School Rosenberg private two-year
* Favorite Subjects: No interest
* Weak Subjects: No interest
* Fighting Style: Third-generation capacity operated chain

According to the game's storyline:
[i]After the great war, the secret organization Drexler had been trying to create artificial Maidens and Arcanas from behind the scenes. Scharlachrot is one of their creations. She had been trained to stand on her own in the battlefields despite her very young age. Compared to [[Weiss (arcana heart)|]], her personality is very extreme and dependent.[/i]

She (similar to [[Weiss (arcana heart)|]]) is one of the young girls trained by the Drexler Institute.

Scharlachrot stands against her in an extremely obsessive manner bordering on dependence. After the organization was taken down by [[Petra Johanna Lagerkvist]], Scharlachrot went missing. However, she reappears in order to oppose [[Weiss (arcana heart)|]] and the rest of the cast. 

She is the mid boss character of the game. Her Arcana, Baldr (Fang), is also a Geist, which shares its name with the Norse god of light and beauty. The Drexler Institute based Baldur on Fenrir, the massive wolf from Norse mythology. 

Scharlachrot is voiced by Yuki Matsuoka.

title: antonov_an-225
body:
The [b]Antonov AN-225 Mriya (Dream)[/b] was an oversized cargo transport [[aircraft]]. It was considered the largest airplane in the world and is used to transport super-heavy loads. It was built by the [[Soviet Union]] to help transport the parts of the rockets made for the Soviet space program. Besides its great size, the AN-225 is known for transporting the "Buran" [[space shuttle]] on its back. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, the plane was transferred to [[Ukraine]], where the Antonov company resides.

In 2022, the plane was lost during the [[Russo-Ukrainian war]] when Russian airstrike delivered from a helicopter targeted its [[hangar]], starting a fire.

body:
[i]Ultra Fight Da! Kyanta 2[/i] is a doujin fighter developed by artist and musician [Haramaself](https://twitter.com/Kasubisha).
The story is set in a version of Japan with fantasy races where the titular Kyanta wields the mysterious Kyanta Force to do battle with the equally enigmatic Michelle.
If it doesn't make sense to you, it's normal, [b]it's not supposed to.[/b]

The game is available for purchase on [Steam](https://store.steampowered.com/app/1026840/Ultra_Fight_Da__Kyanta_2/).

title: the_bad_guys_(film)
body: A 3D animated film developed by [[Dreamworks|DreamWorks Studios]] and released in 2022, based on an Australian series of children's books. The film focuses on a gang of criminal anthropomorphic animals who, after being caught during a heist, attempt to feign reformation to avoid a jail sentence. It is strongly influenced by heist genre films with a 2D-3D visual style inspired by French and Japanese animation, including [[Toriyama Akira|Akira Toriyama]] and [[Lupin III]].

title: short_legs
body: The exact definition is a person with short legs. It is the opposite of {{long_legs}}. Generally, these characters tend to have a short stature, sometimes a long torso and short legs (a disproportionate body). It can be accompanied by {{petite}}.

title: autodromo_internazionale_enzo_e_dino_ferrari
body:
Race track in Imola, Italy; named for Enzo Ferrari and his son Dino. Known as a power track, with lots of high-speed sections, particularly the Tamburello left hand sweeper.

The track became infamous for several spectacular crashes in the late 80s and early 90s, and earned permanent infamy in 1994, when Roland Ratzenberger and Ayrton Senna were killed during the Grand Prix of San Marino weekend that year.

title: cliffjumper
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Cliffjumper[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a red compact [[car]].

In [[Japan]] his name was changed to [b]Cliff[/b].

Motto: [i]"Let me at 'em!...".[/i]

title: bumblebee_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Bumblebee[/b] is an heroic [[Autobot]], a sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a yellow [[Volkswagen Beetle]] compact [[car]].

He is prominently featured in [[transformers_(live_action)|the live action movie series]] as a sidekick of [[Optimus Prime]]. In the movie, he changed his vehicular form into 2007 [[Chevrolet Camaro]] and being [[mute]] most of the time due to damaged sound chip, a trait that is carried over to his later depiction in various media.

In [[Japan]] his name was changed to [b]Bumble[/b]. Bumblebee's alternate mode is similar to [[bug_bite_(gobots)|Bug Bite]]'s from the rival [[GoBots]] franchise.

Motto: [i]"The least likely can be the most dangerous...".[/i]

title: power_plant
body:
A power plant, also referred to as a [i]power station[/i] and sometimes [i]generating station[/i] or [i]generating plant[/i], is an [[industrial]] facility for the generation of [[electricity|electric]] power. Power plants are generally connected to an electrical grid.

title: datehyogo
body: A traditional Japanese hairstyle ([[nihongami]]), and a subtype of the hairstyle; also transliterated as tatehyogo. Unlike the yokogyogo (横兵庫) hairstyle's more triangular shape, the the datehyogo has a more rounded appearance. These two styles of hair can be hard to individually discern in images, however, as art styles can cause the shape to vary. This style stems from [[oiran]], high-class courtesans of Edo Japan. It evolved from the more bow-shaped [[ryohyogo]].

title: su_ruiqi
body:
[[Real life]] Chinese singer. Su Ruiqi is currently active as a soloist, though she was previously a member of the Chinese girl group [[Chic Chili]] (where she went by the mononomous stage name [b]Sury[/b].)

Ruiqi was also a competitor on several idol survival TV series, namely [[Produce 101 China]], [[Produce Camp 2020]], and [[Girls Planet 999]]. While she did not place high enough to debut in any of the groups formed through these shows, her performance on GP999 garnered her an international fanbase in Japan and Korea.

title: shun_goku_satsu
body:
Shun Goku Satsu (瞬獄殺) (also known as the Instant Hell Murder or Raging Demon) is [[Akuma (street fighter)|]]'s signature move in the [[Street Fighter]] series.

The actual attack of the Shun Goku Satsu is never displayed explicitly onscreen. When performed, the user glides towards the opponent and grabs them. Before anything can be seen, the screen blacks out as the character is relentlessly beaten as showcased by a series of flashes. At the end, the opponent is found on the ground, knocked out as the user stands over the opponent, usually with their back turned to the screen, and [[heaven (kanji)|the kanji 天]] (pronounced: [i]ten[/i]) appearing on the user's back and on the background. 

In [[Street Fighter V]], the attack was revealed to be a series of progressively faster teleport punched around the opponent's body until it progressively goes fully black screen again. When slowed down, the punches in particular are shown to be targeting vital weak spots located throughout the body, solidifying that the technique utterly destroys the opponent's body.

h4. See also

* [[Kongou Kokuretsu Zan]]

title: oppai_loli
body:
Used when a female child or child-like character has notably adult-sized breasts, but otherwise retains their child-like proportions. As a good rule of thumb, use the number of heads/breasts tall the character is to decide if they rank as an oppai_loli or not ([i]how many?[/i]). Also note that some oppai_loli pics still need the [[loli]] tag, but [[child|not all]].

h4. Distinction
* [[oppai_loli]] & [[loli]]: post #2015561, post #1320432, post #2116938, post #2298612
* [b][[oppai_loli]] & not [[loli]][/b]: post #891990, post #242796, post #337853, post #2257126
* [b]not [[oppai_loli]] & [[loli]][/b]: post #2342073, post #2220748, post #2374612, post #2326961
* [b]not [[oppai_loli]] & not [[loli]][/b]: post #2404319

If you are not sure whether or not a post should be tagged as loli, ask in the "loli/shota check thread":[/forum/show/33650].

Note that despite using Japanese words, this is an english term, in Japanese these characters are typically called "loli kyonyuu".

h4. Related Tags

* [[child]]
* [[loli]]
* [[lolibaba]]
* [[shortstack]]

title: the_binding_of_isaac
body:
An indie roguelike horror video game created by Edmund McMillen and Florian Himsl. It was initially released in 2011 for PC.

The story plays out like a modern retelling of the titular story from the Bible. [[Isaac (the binding of isaac)|]] is a young boy living with his mother. Things are swell, until one day Mom hears a voice from someone she believes to be God, who eventually tells her to kill her son. Isaac, having learned about this, flees in terror to the basement via a secret trapdoor. [spoiler]How much of this story is real (if anything at all) is left up to debate.[/spoiler]

The game takes primary inspiration from [[The Legend of Zelda]] games, with top-down dungeons to explore, plenty of monsters to fight, and lots of treasure to collect.

It received a full remake in 2014 titled [i]The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth[/i]. On top of the original game, [i]Rebirth[/i] introduces a lot of new enemies, levels, characters, and items. While initially released on PC and the like, Nicalis would help port it over to consoles such as [[Playstation 4]] and [[Nintendo Switch]], the latter of which comes bundled with all of the DLC up to that point ([[the binding of isaac: afterbirth|Afterbirth]] and Afterbirth+, though Repentance needs to be bought separately).

title: shadow_queen
body: The true antagonist and final boss of [[Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door]]. She is a powerful [[demon]] who laid waste to an ancient civilization thousands of years ago. Her true form is that of a [[ghost]]-like figure with [[starry_sky_print|star-like particles coursing through her]]. She [[possessed|possesses]] the body of [[Princess Peach]] during her battle.

title: crossover
body:
A crossover is when two or more characters from unrelated copyrights are shown together in one scene. 

Crossover should not be confused with [[parody]]. A parody implies mimicking a scene or dialogue from another series, with the intention of being humorous.

One character [[cosplay|cosplaying]] as a character from another series does not normally qualify as a crossover.

Use [[songover]] for crossovers between multiple songs or other musical compositions, seen commonly with [[Vocaloid]] songs.

h4. See also

* [[company connection]]
* [[creator connection]]
* [[in-franchise crossover]]
* [[multiple crossover]]
* [[parody]]

title: furrification
body:
When a canonically human or humanoid character is made into a [[furry]]. Posts should generally fit the criteria for being tagged as [[furry]], and not for [[animalization]] or [[kemonomimi mode]]. Characters with canon furry forms are exempt (e.g. the [[Show by Rock!!]] cast).

h4. See also

* [[Animalization]]
* [[Character doll]]
* [[Foodification]]
* [i]Furrification[/i]
* [[Humanization]]
* [[Kemonomimi mode]]
* [[Mechanization]]
* [[Monsterification]]
* [[Objectification]]
* [[Personification]]
* [[Slimification]]
* [[Vehicalization]]
* [[Zombification]]
* [[Tag group:Artistic license]]

body:
[quote][i]Tori and the others are chosen to be the poster boys for a soft drink billboard. 
Hajime is acting quite timidly, since this is his first time working with Tori. Will they be able to close their distance through work...?★[/quote]

An [[Ensemble Stars!]] gacha story written by Yuuki Yoshino. It was released on July 30, 2016, and spans 9 chapters.

It features [[himemiya_tori_|Tori]], [[Shino Hajime|Hajime]], [[fushimi_yuzuru|Yuzuru]] and [[nito_Nazuna|Nazuna]].

title: tezuka's_star_system
body:
A "multiverse" created by [[Tezuka Osamu]] involving character of his works making appearance in his other works, typically in other roles as if they were playing a role like a "real life actors". Many characters were reused from his other works, while some (such as [[Rock (tezuka osamu)|]]) were created specifically as a "superstar" who appeared in several works rather than having one of their own.

[expand=Description from Tezuka Osamu's official site]
The "star system" employed in Tezuka Osamu's Manga differed slightly from its Hollywood namesake, with the characters who appear being handled just like movie [[actor]]s. In other words, as one actor takes on a variety of different roles, so individual characters were given different parts to play.

Aside from the works of Tezuka Osamu, no other Manga artists were using this visionary formula in their writing. It was inconceivable that the star of one Manga would appear as a backseat player in another, and in the guise of the villain at that. 

Nonetheless, Tezuka Osamu thought of his characters as real live actors and actresses and took great pleasure in his role as director in assigning roles to them. Readers who spotted [[Atom (tetsuwan atom)|]] in the guise of the son of a kidnapper in another work would smile with delight. 

Tezuka Osamu even went so far as to think up appearance fees for his characters and his Manga-making techniques overlapped with movie production methods in many ways.
[/expand]

h4. External link
* "Tezukaosamu.net article of the Star System":[https://tezukaosamu.net/en/character/star_system.html]

title: darun_mister
body:
[[Arika]] character, first debuting in [[Street Fighter EX (series)|]], before later appearing in [[Fighting EX Layer]].

He is a [[dark skin|black]] Indian [[wrestling]] champion with a traditional Indian jewel on his forehead and a V-shaped [[mustache]]. He wears black wrestling trunks and boots and gold bracelets on his wrist.

He hears of [[Zangief]]'s legendary wrestling prowess and, bored with his inferior opponents, seeks out the Russian to prove to himself that he is indeed the world's ultimate fighter. He also acts as a bodyguard for [[Pullum Purna]].

title: nowhere_(signalis)
body:
[quote][b][i]PERHAPS, THIS IS HELL[/i][/b][/quote]

A mysterious location in [[Signalis]]'s setting, accessed through a black [[gate]] deep underground on the planet Leng. Nowhere consists of two main places:
* What appears to be a twisted recreation of various places in the S-23 Sierpinski prison complex arranged haphazardly in a non-Euclidean fashion.
* [spoiler]A barren red wasteland dominated by rolling hills and black, rectangular structures poking out of the ground at odd angles. This area is also littered with [[corpse|dead]] [[Elster (Signalis)|Elster units]], and contains the wreckage of the Penrose-512 [[spacecraft]].[/spoiler]

title: honkai_impact_3rd
body:
Chinese mobile game developed by [[miHoYo]], part of the [[honkai_(series)|Honkai Universe]]. An alternate universe to [[Benghuai Xueyuan]], having many of the same characters but different stories. Also known as Honkai 3rd or Houkai 3.

[[Kiana Kaslana]] is the protagonist of the main story up until Part 2, where [[Entropy (honkai impact)|]] replace her.

The player is the protagonist of the secondary story known as Captain's Bizarre Adventure, being the [[Captain_(honkai_impact)|Captain]] of the heavy-class battleship Hyperion instead of [[Murata Himeko]] and traveling across many bubble worlds in the Sea of Quanta.

Since the two games are mostly unrelated, unless it's a collaboration, [b]do not[/b] tag [[Benghuai Xueyuan]] when uploading posts from official sites ("Twitter":[https://twitter.com/houkai3rd/],...), posts that have [b]崩坏3[/b]/[b]Honkai Impact 3[/b] logo or exclusive characters/battlesuits/outfits not from [[Benghuai Xueyuan]].

title: gladiator
body:
A [[warrior]] who fights (often [[slave|unwillingly]]) as a form of mass entertainment, in a [[colosseum]] or other arena.

The arms and armor of such fighters tend towards the spectacular-but-impractical, since spectacle is the whole point. In fantasy works, men often will be [[topless male|bare-chested]], while women often will be wearing [[bikini armor]].

Historically, gladiators originate in the ancient [[Roman Empire]].

title: godzilla_earth
body:
[b]Godzilla Earth[/b], also simply known as [b]Godzilla[/b], is the first [[Godzilla]] of the Anime [[Godzilla (series)|]] continuity, and the second Godzilla within the Toho reboot series of films.

This version of Godzilla made his first formal appearance in the prequel novel, Godzilla: Monster Apocalypse, where it's detailed how Godzilla arose in 2030 and proceeded to lay waste to both humanity and the planet's monster population over the course of 18 years.

Godzilla Earth is by far the largest form of Godzilla yet, standing at nearly 300 meters. This also making it one of the largest [[kaiju|kaiju]] of the entire franchise.

body: A pose from the [[SSSS.Dynazenon]] portion of the [[Gridman Universe]] signified by a hand raised to eye or near eye level and split into a V shape from the middle and ring fingers. Often accompanied by a flash of light, a change in eye color or a glint near the eyes. This is performed when a character from the series uses their powers to take control of a [[Kaiju]].

title: keizer_ghidorah
body: Keizer Ghidorah, also known by his previous form named [[Monster X]], is the main [[kaiju]] antagonist and overall the secondary and final antagonist of the 50th Anniversary Godzilla film, Godzilla: Final Wars.

title: kaijuu_parasite
body:
A fictional lifeform from the [[Pacific Rim]] science fiction series.

[b]Kaijuu Parasites[/b] are a small type of parasites that are attached to the body of [[Kaiju]]. They are similar to ticks and about the size of a human baby.

title: gigan
body:
A [[kaiju|kaiju]] from [[Godzilla (series)|]] series.

Gigan is a peculiar [[alien]] [[cyborg]] kaiju with several parts of its body modified with cybernetic parts. Most notably a large [[visor cap]], a hooked blade in place of an arm, and a saw blade protruding from its stomach.

It was generally depicted as being controlled by an alien and used as a weapon to aid in their intergalactic conquest.

title: king_ghidorah
body:
A [[kaiju|kaiju]] from [[Godzilla (series)|Godzilla]] series, first appeared in its own standalone movie [i]Ghidorah, the Three-Headed Monster[/i] (1964). Since its debut, King Ghidorah has the most theatrical appearance of any kaiju within the series bar Godzilla itself, thus it is often considered an arch-enemy of [[Godzilla]].

King Ghidorah is a large, yellow, [[multiple_heads|three-headed]] [[dragon]] with an ability to shoot lightning bolt from its mouth. It is typically depicted as an alien kaiju who brought devastation upon any planet it made a landfall.

In some depictions, each head of King Ghidorah has its own personality, which led to the characters within that media to name each of Ghidorah's head based on their behavior.

h4. See also
* [[Three-headed dragon (meme)]]

title: giant_monster

title: king_kong_vs._godzilla
body:
A 1962 Japanese [[kaiju]] film directed by Honda Ishirō, with special effects by [[Tsuburaya Eiji]]. Produced and distributed by Toho Co., Ltd, it is the third film in both the [[Godzilla (series)|]] and [[King Kong (series)|]] franchises.

For the 2021 film, see [[Godzilla vs. Kong]].

title: akaishi_kuroe
body: The main character of [[Otome Kaijuu Carameliser]], she is antisocial and often mocked by her classmates. She has an unknown condition that causes her to grow a tail and monstrous  arms when emotionally charged, and when pushed too far, causes her to [[transformation|transform]] into a [[kaiju]] named [[Harugon]].

title: kitoralsus
body:
A species from [i][[Shinkansen Henkei Robo Shinkalion]][/i] that lived on Earth's surface in ancient times, but was forced underground after the meteor that destroyed the dinosaurs collided with the planet. There are very few of them alive at the point of the series, and they send [[kaiju]] to the surface to attack humanity. 

They look similar to humans, although they have [[red eyes|red]] or [[yellow eyes]], [[pale skin]], and either very light [[blonde hair|blonde]] or [[grey hair]]. Some of them have been shown to be able to take on forms indistinguishable from humans, although Genbu and Torame are notable for looking much more monstrous and inhuman compared to the others. They can also take upon kaijuu forms themselves when infused with the black particles they use to create kaijuu on the surface.

[spoilers]The movie reveals that the underground Kitoralsus are not the only group, and that other groups, descended from Kitoralsus that left the planet after the meteor strike, are still present in space and waiting for a chance to return to earth[/spoilers]

h4.Known Kitoralsus

body:

[b]Onibaba[/b] (鬼婆) means "demon hag" in Japanese.

title: kurukuru_(sekai_seifuku)
body:
Little ball-shaped creatures used and possibly invented by Zvezda. They can fuse together into [[kaiju]] (it takes a few thousands of them to form one, though), as individuals they have a form of sentience (to what extent exactly is not known yet) and can also serve as an impromptu inflatable shield (capable of withstanding a few bursts of automatic gun fire), as a hot-air-balloon-like flying device and as a magic satchel (storing a bag bigger than their usual size would normally allow). [[natasha_(sekai_seifuku)|Natasha]] can generate them from her tears as an emergency measure, although how that exactly works, wasn't revealed.

Ambiguous tag. 

The artist formerly tagged here was divided into [[Soutou]] and [[Kurukuru_(P!)]]. 

For some potential artists named Kurukuru: "kurukuru_* search":[/artist?name=kurukuru_*] | "*_kurukuru search":[/artist?name=*_kurukuru]

title: shinkansen_henkei_robo_shinkalion
body:
The first TV anime in the [[Shinkalion (series)|]] franchise, aired from 2018 to 2019 and was followed by a film in late 2019. A sequel, [[Shinkansen Henkei Robo Shinkalion Z]], began airing in April 2021.

The anime focuses on [[Hayasugi Hayato]], who unintentionally finds out his father is a member of a secret government organization that uses the eponymous mecha to fight [[kaiju]] sent by the [[Kitoralsus]]. He becomes the pilot of the [[E5 Hayabusa (shinkalion)|]], and makes friends with other kids who are recruited as pilots alongside him.

title: kaname_(cencoroll)
body:
A character from the manga and film series [[Cencoroll]]. She is a girl who comes to the town where [[tetsu_(cencoroll)|Tetsu]] lives in search of [[shuu_(cencoroll)|Shuu]]. She shows to possess control over more than one [[Cenco]]-like creatures. She first appeared in the 2019 movie [[cencoroll_connect|Cencoroll Connect]].

She has [[black eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]]. She wears a [[white shirt]], [[black skirt]], a [[black necktie]], [[black thighhighs]] and [[glasses]].

She is usually depicted with her [[kaiju|kaiju]] [[hanpen_(cencoroll)|Hanpen]].

She is voiced by [[Takamori Natsumi]].

title: zilla
body:
A [[kaiju|kaiju]] appearing in the 1998 Hollywood film [i][[Godzilla (series)|]][/i] created by Sony Pictures.

It was initially labelled as a "[[Godzilla]]" within the movie, but was subsequently retconned into simply "Zilla" by Toho Films due too how unfaithful to the original it is compared to the original source material. Particularly being designed a lean and relatively small (for a kaiju standard) lizard-like creature, compared to the established theropod-like kaiju design of the original Godzilla.

It has been a subject of ridicule by Toho and fans to the point that Toho has released a reference to it, considering the monster an entirely different species, as well as including it in a [[godzilla_(series)|Godzilla]] anime series only for it to be beaten by the original Godzilla in [i]13 seconds[/i].

title: bioluminescence
body:
Light produced by chemical reactions inside living organisms. It occurs in a diverse array of living species, including fungi, microscopic plankton, [[jellyfish]], [[squid]], and [[anglerfish]].

[[Fireflies]] are likely the most familiar terrestrial example of bioluminescence in nature. In anime art, they are ubiquitous in outdoor environments during summer nights. To avoid crowding out all the less common uses of this tag, fireflies shouldn't be tagged [[bioluminescence]].

h4. See also

* [[glowing]]
* [[glowing mushroom]]
* [[kaiju]]

title: hannibal_chau
body:
A character from the [[Pacific Rim]] science fiction mecha series. He first appeared in the 2013 live action film and was played by American actor "Ron Perlman":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ron_Perlman.

[b]Hannibal Chau[/b] is a black marketeer who makes a living dealing [[Kaiju]] organs.

title: shimo_(monsterverse)
body:
A [[MonsterVerse]] [[kaiju|kaiju]] first debuted in [[Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire]].

Shimo is a massive white sauropod kaiju with an ability to release ice beam. She is currently the largest kaiju in MonsterVerse, standing at over 162 meters, making her even taller than [[Godzilla (monsterverse)|]] or [[King Ghidorah (monsterverse)|]], though her size is usually made less apparent by her preference to walk on all fours.

She was enslaved by [[Skar King]], who uses her as his personal mount in an attempt to overthrow [[Kong (monsterverse)|]] as the ruler of the Hollow Earth [spoiler]Eventually, Shimo was freed and saved by Kong and Godzilla after the duo managed to defeat and kill Skar, and would eventually served as Kong's subordinates in Hollow Earth.[/spoiler]

title: grimm_(rwby)
body:
Fictional species of [[monster|monsters]] from [[RWBY]], a Rooster Teeth series. They are described as "creatures of destruction" which lack souls. Hostile to humanity and drawn towards sources of negative emotions (fear, sorrow, etc.).  

Grimm are commonly black, with white armored patches, red markings, and [[glowing_eyes|glowing]] [[red eyes]].  

h4. Species

* [[Beowolf]] - resembling large wolves or werewolves
* [[Beringel]] - bulky gorilla
* [[Boarbatusk]] - large boar
* [[creep_(RWBY)|Creep]] - resembles theropod dinosaurs but lacks forelimbs
* [[death_stalker (rwby)|Death Stalker]] - giant scorpion
* [[geist_(rwby)|Geist]] - ghost-like creature with one eye on an otherwise blank face(plate), two arms, and waist trails instead of legs; can possess inanimate objects, exposing only its faceplate
** [[Armor Gigas]] - A western-style suit of full plate armor with greatsword, stated in manga to be animated by a possession-type Grimm
** [[Petra Gigas]] - A golem-like collection of boulders possessed by a Geist.
* [[goliath_(rwby)|Goliath]] - elephant
* [[Griffon_(rwby)|Griffon]] - griffin
* [[Grimm Dragon]] - giant wyvern
* [[the_hound_(rwby)|The Hound]] - [spoiler]Intelligent Grimm, capable of shapeshifting and speech, with a debatably-alive Faunus as a "core"[/spoiler]
* [[King Taijitu]] - giant double-headed snake (one head on each end, no tail)
* [[Leviathan_(rwby)|Leviathan]] - Gargantuan [[kaiju]]-like mosnter resembling and fighting like [[Godzilla]]
* [[manticore_(rwby)|Manticore]] - Fireball-breathing winged lion
* [[monstra_(rwby)|Monstra]] - [spoiler]Colossal flying whale used by [[salem_(rwby)|Salem]] as "living" transport and mothership[/spoiler]
* [[nevermore_(rwby)|Nevermore]] - raven, appears in both normal-crow-sized and giant-sized varieties
* [[nuckelavee_(rwby)|Nuckelavee]] - Nightmare horse with legless humanoid "rider" fused onto center of horseback; "rider" can stretch arms to attack
* Orochi ([i]name?[/i]) - Appears in manga; [spoiler]fuses 4 King Taijitu into one eight-headed monster ([[blake_belladonna|Blake]] references Yamata-no-Orochi when talking about it)[/spoiler]
* [[Sabyr_(rwby)|Sabyr]] - Resembles a [[smilodon]] or [[sabertooth cat]]
* [[Sea Feilong]] - Japanese dragon, [spoiler]can swim or extend fins into wings to fly, breathes electric energy beam[/spoiler]
* [[sphinx_(rwby)|Sphinx]] - Larger Manticore Grimm whose tail is a snake head/body
* [[ursa_(rwby)|Ursa]] - large bear (plural Ursai, larger ones may be called Ursa Major)

title: mothra
body:
A giant [[moth]] [[kaiju|kaiju]] from the [[Godzilla (series)|Godzilla]] series.

Unlike the other kaijus, Mothra is almost always depicted as a heroic kaiju (unlike [[Godzilla]] who typically takes the role of an anto-protagonist), almost always act as the protector of the Earth, nature, and civilizations. She is also one the rare female kaijus in the series, and can also communicate with humans via her accompanied [[fairy]] followers.

Due to her popularity, she is often referred to as the "queen of the monsters" and the "nature's goddess".

She later returns in [[SSSS.Dynazenon]] as an adult.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Takahashi Karin]] (高橋花林).

title: suzaku_(shinkalion)
body:
A character from [i][[Shinkansen Henkei Robo Shinkalion]][/i]. She has [[red eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[bangs]], and [[medium breasts]], and wears an outfit that leaves her [[midriff]] exposed. She is the only female [[Kitoralsus]] agent in the series and is interested in human emotions, often using the black particles to create [[kaiju]] that touch on the main casts' emotional hangups. 

Her kaijuu form is a [[giantess|giant woman]] with [[purple skin]], a [[dragon]] themed helmet with [[fins]] that covers her eyes, and large [[pauldrons]].

title: school_girl_strikers
body:
A mobile game released in 2014 by [[Square Enix]] for iOS and Android.

It features 37 fully voiced characters.

The game engine was used to create [[Pop-up Story]].

The game's main story line concluded on 8 May 2018, after which point the game was rebranded as School Girl Strikers 2 and a new story began.

An anime adaptation titled [i]Schoolgirl Strikers Animation Channel[/i] was created by studio J.C. Staff for the January-March 2017 season.

title: akihabara_radio_kaikan
body:
The Akihabara Radio Kaikan (秋葉原ラジオ会館, Akihabara Rajio Kaikan), Akihabara Radio Hall is a commercial building in Tokyo, Japan and is one of the most well-known landmarks in the Akihabara district. The recent building was built in 2014 after the old building was demolished in 2011. The building is 46.5 m high, is ten levels from the ground floor and has two basement levels.  The current building primarily hosts stores selling otaku goods. ("Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akihabara_Radio_Kaikan)

The building plays a prominent role in the [[Steins;Gate]] franchise.

title: bamboo_slips
body:
Bamboo and wooden slips (simplified Chinese: 简牍; traditional Chinese: 簡牘; pinyin: jiǎndú) are long, narrow strips of wood or bamboo, each typically holding a single column of several dozen brush-written characters. They were the main media for writing documents in China before the widespread introduction of paper during the first two centuries AD.

h4. See also

* [[Scroll]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bamboo and wooden slips":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bamboo_and_wooden_slips]

title: miao
body:
The Miao are a group of linguistically-related peoples living in Southern China and Southeast Asia, which are recognized by the government of China as one of the 56 official ethnic groups. The Miao live primarily in southern China's mountains, in the provinces of Guizhou, Yunnan, Sichuan, Hubei, Hunan, Guangxi, Guangdong and Hainan. Some sub-groups of the Miao, most notably the [[Hmong]] people, have migrated out of China into Southeast Asia (Myanmar, Northern Vietnam, Laos and Thailand). Following the communist takeover of Laos in 1975, a large group of Hmong refugees resettled in several Western nations, mainly in the United States, France and Australia.

h4. See also
* [[Miao clothes]]
** [[Miao clothes]]
** [[Miao hat]]

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Miao people":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miao_people]

title: f-5_freedom_fighter
body:
The [b]Northrop F-5A/B Freedom Fighter[/b] is part of a family of lightweight twin-engine [[jet]] fighter developed by Northrop in the 1950s and first produced in 1962. The aircraft was later modified into the [[f-5 freedom fighter|F-5E/F Tiger II]], a more advanced version introduced in 1972. 

Cheap, easy to operate and maintain, the F-5 is still in wide use with several air forces worldwide. It is equipped with a flat fuselage underside with a small tailhook; clipped-delta wings with wingtip missile rails and fixed armament comprising 2 20mm cannons in its nose. Up to 7,000 lbs (3,200 kg) of fuel stores can be carried on its weapon stations.

h4. See also

* [[F-20 Tigershark]]
* [[Area 88]]
* [[List of Airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Northrop F-5":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_F-5

title: asatsuki_(cookie)
body:
* !post #1898981

The first voice actress candidate for [[Konpaku Youmu|]] in [[Cookie (Touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]]. She declined the offer after fearing the community. Although her account name is Asatsuki (朝月), she is called  ASUTEKA (Japanese pronunciation for "[[aztec|Azteca]]") by community, and has been drawn as a tribal version of Youmu with [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]].

Somewhat similar to [[Kochiko (cookie)|]] she wasn't very good at singing due to her distinct voice. This began the joke that her voice would cause the Mayan apocalypse, involving raining [[Olmec head]]s, spontaneous [[mesoamerican architecture|Mesoamerican]] [[pyramid (structure)|]]s, and explosions.

title: f-22_raptor
body:
The [b]Lockheed Martin F-22 Raptor[/b] is an American fifth generation single-seat, twin-engine state-of-the-art advanced fighter [[aircraft]] that uses stealth technology. It was designed primarily as an air superiority fighter, but has several additional capabilities that include ground attack, electronic warfare and reconnaissance. 

The F-22 was developed from the original YF-22 prototype flight tested during 1990. The first mass produced F-22s first flew in 1997 and were officially introduced several years later in 2005. 

The F-22 is the first mass produced fifth generation aircraft ever created and is still considered the most advanced operational fighter jet in the world. Lockheed Martin Aeronautics and Boeing Defense continue to be major partners in maintaining the United States of America Raptor fleet. 

h4. Other fifth generation jets

* [[F-35 Lightning II]]
* [[su-57|Sukhoi PAK FA]]
* [[Chengdu j-20]]
* [[Shenyang j-31]]

h4. See also

* [[FB-22]]
* [[List of airplanes]]
* "Lockheed-Martin webpage":http://www.lockheedmartin.com/us/products/f22.html
* Wikipedia: "Lockheed-Martin F-22 Raptor":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_Martin_F-22_Raptor

title: f-35_lightning_ii
body:
The [b]Lockheed Martin F-35 Lightning II[/b] is a family of single-seat, single-engine, fifth generation multirole [[jet]] fighters under development to perform ground attack, reconnaissance, and air defense missions with stealth capability. 

The F-35 has three main models: the F-35A is a conventional takeoff and landing variant, the F-35B is a Short Take-Off and Vertical Landing variant (with [[VTOL]] capability while not carrying additional armament), and the F-35C is a heavier carrier-based variant.

The JSF program was designed to replace the United States military [[f-16 fighting falcon|F-16]]s, [[A-10 Thunderbolt II|A-10]]s, [[f-18 hornet|F-18]]s (excluding newer E/F "Super Hornet" variants) and [[hawker harrier|AV-8B]]s tactical fighter aircraft.

The Shenyang [[Shenyang j-31]] is very similar to this jet.

h4.See also

* [[F-22 Raptor]]
* [[List of Airplanes]]

title: shenyang_j-15
body:
The [b]Shenyang J-15[/b] (simplified Chinese: 歼-15; traditional Chinese: 殲-15) is an advanced carrier-based, twin-engine fourth/four-point-five-generation multirole [[fighter jet]] being developed by the [i]Shenyang Aerospace Corporation[/i] specifically for the Chinese [[People's Liberation Army Navy|People's Liberation Army Naval Air Force]] (PLANAF). It was reversed-engineered from the T-10K-3, a [[Su-33]] (navalized [[Su-27]]) prototype purchased from [[Ukraine]] in 2001, and further developed to use indigenous technologies from the [[Shenyang j-11|J-11B]] program.

The J-15 conducted its first takeoff from a simulated ski-jump on land on May 7, 2010. On November 25, 2012, the aircraft successfully performed its first takeoff and landing on [[liaoning_(aircraft_carrier)|Liaoning]], China's first operational [[aircraft carrier]]. It entered mass production in December 2013. The J-15 is viewed as an interim carrier-based fighter until a fifth-generation successor enters service, one that may be based on the Chengdu [[Chengdu j-20]] or Shenyang [[Shenyang j-31]].

The J-15 features a internal 30mm [[cannon]] and 12 external hardpoints which can mount the [[PL-8]] and [[PL-10]] infrared-homing air-to-air [[missile|missiles]], the [[PL-12]] and [[PL-15]] active-radar air-to-air missiles, the [[YJ-38]] anti-ship missile, the [[KD-88]] air-to-ground missile, the [[YJ-91]] anti-radar missile, a variety of bombs, rockets, and the UPAZ-1A buddy refueling pod. A two-seater variant used for electronic warfare exists. Starting from the J-15B it was upgraded with CATOBAR launch capability, AESA radar, and stealth coatings. As of 2023, at least 60 airframes have been produced.

h4. See also

* [[Shenyang j-16]]
* [[Su-33]]
* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Shenyang J-15":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shenyang_J-15

title: shenyang_j-16
body:
The [b]Shenyang J-16[/b] (simplified Chinese: 歼-16; traditional Chinese: 殲-16) is an advanced tandem-seat, twin-engine fourth-generation multirole [[fighter jet]] being developed by the [i]Shenyang Aerospace Corporation[/i] for the Chinese [[People's Liberation Army Air Force]] (PLAAF). It was developed from the Shenyang [[Shenyang j-11]], which in turn was developed as an indigenous variant of the Russian [[Su-27]].

The J-16 made its maiden flight between 2011–2012 (est), and entered service in 2014. The electronic warfare version of the fighter, named J-16D, was developed in 2010s and reportedly made its first flight in 2015. The J-16 platform is rumored to be the foundation for research-and-development into advanced autonomous combat capabilities.  In March 2021, it was reported that a J-16 variant with the backseat co-pilot replaced by an artificial intelligence algorithm called "intelligence victory" (智胜) was undergoing testing at Shenyang Aircraft Corporation.

The J-16 has a 30mm [[cannon]] and a total of 12 external hardpoints which can carry [[PL-10]] infrared-homing air-to-air [[missile|missiles]], [[PL-15]] and [[PL-21]] active-radar homing missiles, [[YJ-83]] anti-ship missiles, [[KD-88]] air-to-ground missiles, as well as bombs, rockets, and external targeting pods. The J-16D replaces the cannon with an internal electronics warfare system and carries wingmounted pods. As of early November 2022, 245+ J-16 airframes have been produced. 

h4. See also

* [[Shenyang j-15]]
* [[Su-27]]
* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Shenyang J-16":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shenyang_J-16

title: chengdu_j-10
body:
The [b]Chengdu J-10 "Vigorous Dragon" (威龙)[/b] (simplified Chinese: 歼-10; traditional Chinese: 殲-10) is a single-engined [[canards|canard]]-and-delta-wing fourth-generation multirole [[fighter jet]] produced by the [i]Chengdu Aircraft Industry Corporation[/i] for the Chinese [[People's Liberation Army Air Force]] (PLAAF), [[People's Liberation Army Navy|People's Liberation Army Naval Air Force]] (PLANAF) and the [[Pakistan Air Force]] (PAF). 

The J-10 made its maiden flight on 23 March 1998, and entered operation in 2006. The J-10 is mainly designed for air-to-air combat, but can also perform strike missions. It features 11 hardpoints which can carry [[PL-8]] and [[PL-10]] infrared-homing air-to-air [[missile|missiles]], [[PL-12]] and [[PL-15]] active-radar air-to-air missiles, [[KD-88]] air-to-ground missiles, or [[YJ-91]] anti-radiation air-to-ground missiles as well as bombs (guided and unguided), fuel tanks, or a variety of targeting pods.

As of 2022, there have been 602+ airframes of all J-10 variants produced.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* [[Chengdu j-10]]
* Not to be confused with [[J-10 (muv-luv)|]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Chengdu J-10":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chengdu_J-10
* Aviationfans.com: [s]h[/s][s]ttp://www.aviationfans.com/node/11[/s] (Dead link)

title: dao_fu
body:
A symbol used as a good-luck charm in Chinese-speaking countries. It consists of the character [[Good Fortune Symbol|福]] being placed upside down. 

Commonly seen on the square-shaped [[Chinese New Year]] decoration, the [[doufang]].

倒 ([i]dao[/i], literally "upside-down") 福 ([i]fu[/i], "fortune" or "good luck") is a homonym of 到福 ("fortune arrives") in Chinese (and most dialects of Chinese).

h5. Examples
* !post #7692318
* !post #7201130
* !post #7287853
* !post #6448621
* !post #4855871

* Mangaka [[Kobayashi Motofumi]] and military writer "Umemoto Hiroshi":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A2%85%E6%9C%AC%E5%BC%98] created fictional "manga":[http://myanimelist.net/manga/76189/Happy_Tiger] & "novel":[https://www.amazon.co.jp/gp/search?field-keywords=%E6%A2%85%E6%9C%AC%E5%BC%98+%E3%83%8F%E3%83%83%E3%83%94%E3%83%BC%E3%82%BF%E3%82%A4%E3%82%AC%E3%83%BC%E6%88%A6%E8%A8%98] stories titled "[[Happy Tiger]]", being inspired by "a photo of the Dao Fu Tiger I":[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Bundesarchiv_Bild_101III-Gutscher-001-03,_Russland,_SS-Division_%22Das_Reich%22,_Tiger-Panzer.jpg].
* [[Prune Touri]]/Prune Tao-Li is a character from [[Armored Core]] ("1" and "[[armored_core:_master_of_arena|Master of Arena]]") whose AC mecha has the name & emblem "Tou-Fuku/Dao-Fu (倒福号)".

h4.See also

title: sol_qamar_(idolmaster)
body:
Sol Qamar is an idol unit featured in THE iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls, consisting of the idols: Layla and Natalia.

Their first appearance together as a unit was on January 9th, 2015, as a 9th Idol LIVE Royale rival unit, before given their current name, which was revealed on January 10th, 2017, as a 21st Idol LIVE Royale rival unit in the mobile game Cinderella Girls.
Their unit names in order include:

Tropical Country New Year (南国ニューイヤー Nangoku Nyuu Iyaa) - Debut on January 9th, 2015, marking their first official unit appearance.
Plains Walk Dancers (プレーンズウォーク・ダンサーズ Pureenzu Wooku Dansaazu) - Debut on October 21st, 2015.
Arabian Dancers (アラビアンダンサーズ Arabian Dansaazu) - Debut on July 8th, 2016.
Sol Qamar (ソル・カマル Soru Kamaru) - Debut on January 10th, 2017. This is their unit name from onwards.

Their unit name is a mix of two languages: Portuguese and Arabic. Sol means sun in Portuguese, and Qamar (قمر) means moon in Arabic.

title: kuka_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from [[Princess Connect!]] and Princess Connect! Re:Dive. She is a member of the guild Weiß Flügel Landsol Branch. Noted for her [[masochism]].

She has [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] stylized with [[bangs]], [[hair between eyes]], [[sidelocks]] & [[two side up]]. She wears a [[black leotard|black]] [[heart print|heart]] [[print leotard]], black [[bridal gauntlets]], [[heart hair ornament]]s, [[cuffs]][[cuffs-to-collar|-to-]][[metal collar|collar]] [[chain]]s, [[faulds]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]].

Usually depicted with [[heart-shaped pupils]] and/or with a [[torogao]] expression.

[[official_alternate_costume|Alternate in-game outfits]] of hers include:

* [[kuka_(oedo)_(princess_connect!)|Oedo Kuka]]
* [[kuka_(noire)_(princess_connect!)|Noire Kuka]]
* [[kuka (summer) (princess connect!)|Summer Kuka]]

[spoiler]Her name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[kuka (real) (princess connect!)|Tomi Kuuka]] (遠見 空花).[/spoiler]

h4. See Also

* "Princess Connect Re:Dive Wiki: Kuuka":https://princess-connect.fandom.com/wiki/Kuuka_Tomi

title: nakano_yotsuba
body:
A character in [[Go-toubun no Hanayome]] and fourth of the Nakano [[quintuplets|Quintuplet]] sisters. Yotsuba is always cheerful, friendly, and good at sports. However, her constantly active personality can annoy others. She likes watching anime and her best subject is Japanese.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[orange hair]] [[bob cut]] stylized with [[bangs]] & [[hair between eyes]]. She wears a [[green ribbon|green]] [[hair ribbon]] and her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[open jacket|open]] [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]], [[yellow sweater]]/[[yellow sweater vest]], [[plaid bow|plaid]] [[green bow]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], and [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]].

Her [[voice actor|voice actress]] is [[Sakura Ayane]].

title: ibaraki_douji_(touhou)
body:
[spoiler]The true form of [[Ibaraki Kasen]] after she fused with her [[Ibaraki Douji's Arm|once missing arm]].

Her appearance is mostly the same except that she now has manacles with [[Ball And Chain Restraint]]s on each limb. Her dress [[Sleeveless|no longer has sleeves]] and is now longer and colored white, with her [[Tabard]] having turned a much darker color. She has also gained a pair of [[Horns]] and her hair has [[Long Hair|grown much longer]].[/spoiler]

title: flower_on_head
body:
Use this tag when a flower (or a bunch of flowers) [b]grows[/b] on top of a character's head, usually with a stem and a set of leaves. The [[pikmin_(creature)|Pikmins]] from the [[pikmin (series)|eponymous series]] are examples of this tag.

In anime and manga, a flower growing from a character’s head is sometimes an allusion to the Japanese term "脳内お花畑 (nōnai o-hanabatake)":[https://www.japandict.com/%E8%84%B3%E5%86%85%E3%81%8A%E8%8A%B1%E7%95%91] - literally "garden in the brain" - symbolizing that a character is being "carefree, happy-go-lucky, silly, or stupid":[https://www.japanesewithanime.com/2021/06/flower-on-head.html]. Examples of this would be [[shinomiya_kaguya|Kaguya]] in her “bakaguya”/moron mode and [[pallas_(arknights)|Pallas]] from [[Arknights]].

Not to be confused with [[hair flower]].

h4. See also

* [[hair flower]]
* [[head wreath]]
* [[plant hair]]
* [[plant on head]]

title: millia_rage
body:
Assassin from [i][[Guilty Gear]][/i] who was orphaned during the Crusades and was formerly a member of the Assassin's Guild. She is haunted by [[Zato-1]]/[[eddie (guilty gear)|Eddie]], and seeks to solve her problem with him once and for all.

She is easily noticeable by her long, [[prehensile hair|transformable]] wild hair and is a favorite among fans of the series.

title: blowtorch
body:
Also referred to as a blowlamp, a blowtorch is an ambient air fuel-burning tool used for applying flame and heat to various applications, usually in metalworking. The most common and known variant is the handheld propane torch, whose main use is for soldering and brazing.

Not to be confused with [[flamethrower]], which is a weapon designed to launch fire at distance.

h4. External Links

"Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blowtorch?useskin=vector]

title: akg_k-series_headphones
body:
For tagging purposes, [[headphones]] with a structure resembling [[Akiyama Mio]]'s AKG K701.

Most of them happen to be AKG K-something, but some others (Q701 for example) have a similar look and structure and still count. Likewise, headphones technically in the K-series that don't share this look (such as K553 with a different headband) don't count. If you can think of a better name for the tag, bring it up in the forum.

Notable visual traits:
* Large circular cups with a smaller circular section sticking out in the middle
* Headband with a pair of almost-parallel sticks separate from the pad that rests on the head, usually with visible circular attachment points

* !asset #22087836: K701[br][url=https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:AKG_K701_headphones.jpg]Jud McCranie, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons[/url]
* !asset #22087837: K240[br][url=https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:AKG_K240_headphones.jpg]Jud McCranie, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons[/url]

title: pengin_pina
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber]] and 3rd batch member of [[Prism Project]]. She's a short [[penguin girl]]. She wears a marching band themed green dress with detached sleeves, thighhighs, green platform boots and a shako cap. She has two-tone hair, mostly blonde, with an orange one-side up that resemble feathers. She also has aqua eyes. 

While a bit of an accidental airhead, she has a very calming presence in her streams and her collabs. 

She has a mascot called Broguin, a giant muscular Emperor penguin that acts as a bodyguard of sorts. 

Her fans are jokingly called "pps", short for "PenPals"

Her character designer is [[rinotuna]].

h4. External links
* "YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/c/PinaPengin]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/pinapengin]

title: floyag
body:
A group of [[Yume Nikki]] characters that reside in the Infinite [[Road]]. They seem to be at a distance from the [[road]].

h4. Appearance

There are six variants of Floyag, each shaped like a [[uterus]], with eyes and what seems to be a mouth or [[third eye]]. They are also strikingly similar to [[iris (flower)|iris flowers]].

* The first is tall and pink, with red facial features.
* The second is short and purple, with pink and red features.
* The third is as tall as the first, but duller, with black and pink eyes, a wider, multi-colored mouth, and a fourth feature in the mid-section. The bottom also seems slightly wider.
* The fourth is short as well, but wider and red, with pink and purple eyes, and a red and pink mouth.
* The fifth is tall, fat, and dull purple, with features similar to the third.
* The sixth is only encountered before exiting. It is short and dark green, with blue and red features. When [[Madotsuki]] exits the road, its eyes focus on her. 

h4. External link

* "Yume Nikki Wiki":[https://yumenikki.fandom.com/wiki/Floyag]

body: Xochimilco (Spanish pronunciation: [ʃotʃiˈmilko]; Classical Nahuatl: Xōchimīlco, pronounced [ʃoːtʃiˈmiːlko] ) is a borough (demarcación territorial) of [[Mexico City]]. body: Club Deportivo Guadalajara, nicknamed "Chivas" (lit. 'Goats'), is a [[mexico|Mexican]] professional football club based in the [[Guadalajara]] metropolitan area, Jalisco, Mexico. title: ayerscarpe_(arknights)
body:
[i]Ayerscarpe, Messenger Bodyguard, will provide support in accordance with the terms of his contract.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Rim Billiton[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 25[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Cautus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]173 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]1 year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Friend and bodyguard of the Catastrophe Messenger [[Leonhardt (arknights)|]].

He has the strange habit of carrying everywhere and eating salted edamame, shell included. He asks electricity-based operators to electrocute him, such as [[Greyy (arknights)|]], [[Leizi (arknights)|]] and [[Goldenglow (arknights)|]].

His weapon is a failed prototype made by [[Rhine Lab (arknights)|]], which was then sold in the black market of Rim Billiton. It is only functional in his hands because of his habit of getting electrocuted.

His motif is based on the Mini Lop rabbit.

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Kaji Yuuki]] (Japanese), Huang Jinze (Chinese), and Kim Myung-jun (Korean). His art designer is [[NoriZC]].

h4. Skins
* !post #3991917: Default
* !post #3991919: Elite II

title: hyacinth
body:
[b][i]Hyacinthus[/i][/b], commonly called hyacinth, is a genus of [[flower]]ing bulbous plants in the family [i]Asparagaceae[/i].

Hyacinths have tubular, six-petaled flowers that grow in clusters on a leafless, sturdy stem. Cultivated species, such as [i]Hyacinthus orientalis[/i], often form denser clusters, while wild species may have as few as two or three flowers in an inflorescence. Cultivated hyacinths can be almost any color. The leaves are upright and strap-shaped, emerging from the underground bulb and surrounding the stem. The whole plant usually grows to a height of 15-35 cm (6-13.8 in).

h5. Examples
* !asset #22077055: Photo reference, individual flowers
* !asset #22077054: Photo reference, plant
* !post #3112557: Individual flower
* !post #5983459

h5. Other Asparagaceae species
* [[Agave]]
* [[Asparagus]]
* [[Bluebell (flower)|]]
* [[Grape hyacinth]]

* [[Lily of the valley]]

h4. External links

title: off-shoulder_bandeau
body:
A specific type of [[bandeau]] that is [i]naturally designed[/i] with a low and wide-cut neckline, not covering the shoulders or upper chest area, leaving them [[bare shoulders|bare]].

An important distinction that this bandeau type has (unlike regular bandeaus) is that off-shoulder bandeaus have attached sleeves/sleeve-like garments that sit on the upper arms instead of on top of the shoulders.

Some [[off-shoulder bikini]]s that have bandeau-type torso garments can also qualify as an off-shoulder bandeau.

h4.Correct examples
* !post #5793375
* !post #3561657
* !post #874232
* !post #5095086
* !post #4706818: The girl on the right, with the pink [[off-shoulder bikini]] top

h4.Incorrect examples
* !post #7273013: A regular bandeau
* !post #7467692: A regular bandeau with [[detached sleeves]]
* !post #7180797: Ditto
* !post #6483621: An [[off-shoulder bikini]] that is not narrow enough to qualify as a "bandeau"

h4.See also

* [[Off shoulder]]

* [[Off-shoulder dress]]

title: draw_me_like_one_of_your_french_girls_(meme)
body:
A famous line from the scene in [[Titanic (movie)|]] where [[rose dewitt bukater|Rose]] asks [[jack dawson|Jack]] to [[nude modeling|draw her nude]].

There are several aspects to this meme, frequently appearing in conjunction:
* The line itself, or some variation thereof (with the form "Draw me like one of your X") is spoken.
* One character (not necessarily female and not necessarily nude) adopts the same pose Rose does: [[lying]] [[on side|on their side]] on a [[couch]], with both [[arms up]] and one [[arm behind head|behind their head]], while another character draws them.
* Other elements from the scene may also be reproduced, such as the specific fancy couch with green upholstery.
* A [[3koma|three-panel format]], consisting of a close up of the model's face, a close up of the artist's face, followed by a wider shot of the model, with the sketchbook visible in the lower right corner. Often feature a gag punchline where the "artist" is revealed to have no artistic ability whatsoever, or to have drawn something completely different.

title: project_luminasys
body:
Project Luminasys (Luminescence, alternatively spelled Luminasis) is an ongoing idol project made by the artist [[ohisashiburi]] comprised of 14 characters, and 5 teams. The setting for the world isn't known as a whole and only given very sparely. The following information may not be 100 percent accurate.

h4. Characters

h5. PURE♡LOVE
= Is the main unit of the project in where our main character is apart of.
* [[Kirara Akaru]] (Cv. Yui Horie): An ordinary middle school student with a troubled past. A happy go lucky attitude, it seems that she tries her best to stay positive despite her situation. She is the main character of the series. Kirara started her idol activities at [[komurasaki kuo|Kuo's]] recommendation. After her mother is rendered comatose from an accident, she is left to live with a distant relative.

* [[Komurasaki Kuo]] (Cv. Maaya Uchida): Kuo is the twin sister of mignon unit member [[komurasaki muma|Muma]]. She has a strong sense of inferiority towards her older sister, and deems her a rival; though one sided. After her sister had made her debut as an idol, she had decided to make a career for herself as an idol, aswell.

* [[Yurizono Eryu]] (Cv. Hikasa Yoko): As the sole daughter of an affluent family, she is subsequently forced to listen to her parents nagging for her to take over the family business, and thus give up on her dreams. It seems she refused. She is acquainted with [[hatane rona|Rona]] in school, but due to her disappearing, she had became a loner.

h5. MIGNON

* [[Komurasaki Muma]] (Cv. Hidaka Rina): The older twin sister of [[komurasaki kuo|Kuo]]. She is said to have a very mature personality for her age. 'muma' is her stage name.

* [[Kano Shirayuki]] (Cv. Kayano Ai): The leader of the mignon unit group, and the daughter of a famous company within the universe. Her appearance is deceiving, as she likes to cause mischief regularly and play pranks on others. Its mentioned that she has a younger brother who looks exactly like her.

* [[Fukami Levy]] (Cv. Wakai Yuki): She proclaims herself to be 'cool' and 'mysterious'. Has an "accent when she speaks":[/posts/3937411?q=fukami_levy], and appears to swear a lot. It's said that she has an extreme secondary illness, though undisclosed. 

h5. CAROL / CALOR

* [[Katanaya Mashiko]] (Cv. Minami Tanaka): She is the youngest out of all the Luminasys characters. Characterized by a boyish appearance, she acts very mature for her age.

* [[Sazanami Tsudzuru]] (Cv. Hibiku Yamamura): She is often seen wearing very traditional Japanese clothing, and most of her outfits will by only slightly modernized. Tzudzuru is said to be a delinquent that often skips class.

h5. MYSTIC NOVA / MYSTICNOVA
= It is a team made up of foreign students only. Unlike pure♡love, which emphasizes cuteness, it emphasizes charisma.
* [[Svetiana]] (alternatively Svetlana): She is a Russian student studying at the school. She has very bad anxiety and is typically unable to speak up, whether it be for herself, or for others. Only a select few are able to get her to speak. Since her real name seems to be Hikaru Hoshimachi, the initial setting of her being an international student is not made clear. Whether she is an international student or of mixed race, is up in airs.

* [[Layla (ohisashiburi)|]] (alternatively Lyla): A Brazilian student, perhaps due to that, she is the only character with darker skin out of all of the group(s). She is the tallest out of all the characters in the series, and is said to be very good at lying and deception.

* [[Yuson (ohisashiburi)|]] (alternatively Meteor): A Korean student. Due to her overwhelming talent in singing, dancing and makeup, she is very popular with other teenage girls and has many followers on social media.

h5. RESARCANA
= Although a unit, there is only one member.
* [[Hatane Rona]]: Rona is a girl said to be blessed and adored by god, beautiful looks and incredible talent, she is envied. Early on, she used to be acquainted with [[yurizono eryu|Eryu]] growing up. However, it is undisclosed the reason as to why she no longer met with her. Due to another series of mistakes made by her, she had became the reason as to why [[kirara akaru|Kirara's]] mother became comatose, and subsequently making her an orphan. 

h5. MISC
= These characters did not exist initially, but were added later on.
* [[nemui (ohisashiburi)|Kusuri Nemui]]: A girl with very long hair in drills, she is shown to be a very big fan of [[kirara akaru|Kirara]].

* [[neon girl (ohisashiburi)|Okuoka Kimi]]: A girl with tomboyish characteristics. Her distinctive features are her very sharp eyes and multiple piercings. She is a singer/songwriter, and is shown to be in a unit with Nemui (though unnamed as of now).

h4. External links

* "Youtube":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClPh7Axlf5SbRK_CsSzQlBA]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/pjt_Lmnsys]

title: vietnamese_high_school_uniform
body:
Most schools in Vietnam requires uniform, and the rules on uniform vary from schools and areas. The most common type of uniform consists of a white shirt with school logo on left sleeve and navy/black trousers, with a red scarf for students from grade 3 to grade 9. This kind of uniform is often seen in public schools in North Vietnam or in rural areas, and there is no differences between boy's and girl's uniforms. However, many schools (private or famous public schools) have their own designed uniforms, which often replace trousers with skirts for girls or include bows, ties or vests/blazers.

The white áo dài is also a tradition uniform for high school girls in Vietnam, but most schools in Northern Vietnam only require it for important events or ceremonies, since wearing áo dài is uncomfortable for daily use. Otherwise, áo dài is very familiar with school girls in Mekong Delta, where it is "daily uniform" of all them. The image of a high school girl with nón lá and white áo dài on a bike is still considered symbolic nowadays.

There are also uniform for Physical Education in Vietnam schools, usually includes T-shirt and tracksuit, which the T-shirts have school logo on them. The tracksuit jacket is popular and often used as winter uniform, even out of gym activity.

There are no specific shoes for Vietnamese students, however flip-flops, slippers and high heels are forbidden. Sandals and boots are allowed, although students would wear sneakers or flats to school. Dyeing hair, nail polish and make-up are banned in many schools.

title: chiitan
body:
A genderless 0 year old fairy baby otter who wears a turtle as a hat that was the self-proclaimed [[yuru-chara]] of the small Japanese port city of [[Susaki]]. Best known for their quirky YouTube videos and social media posts performing a variety of awkward and violent stunts.

In May 2019, Chiitan lost all of their original Twitter accounts, suspected to be a result of the controversial nature of their antics, prompting the creation of new accounts. 2019 was also marked by legal threats of copyright infringement from Susaki officials beginning in February, which would be dismissed in September.

body:

In [[Dragon Ball Heroes]], he is called by the name [b]Dr. W[/b] and appears with a humanoid [[cyborg]] design, unlike his movie appearance. His main appearance in Heroes is that of an older man with a cyborg eye (post #7828122), but it gives way for a much more robotic [[cyclops]] design not long after.

title: salsa_(dragon_ball)
body:
Not to be confused with [[Salza]].

Salsa is a [[demon]] from [[Dragon Ball Heroes]] with a [[cat]] motif. He appears highly loyal to [[Mechikabura]] and is seen as his right-hand man. He specializes in attacks based on [[tornado|tornadoes]] and wind.

[Spoilers] After Mechikabura uses Salsa alongside the rest of his allies for power, Salsa appears deeply bitter and his cheery personality is traded for a moodier one. Alongside [[putine (dragon ball)|Putine]], he allies with the [[time patrol (dragon ball)|Time Patrol]] to stop [[towa (dragon ball)|Towa]] from bringing the second coming of Mechikabura. [/spoilers]
other_names: サルサ(ドラゴンボール)

title: putine_(dragon_ball)
body:
Putine is a [[demon]] from [[Dragon Ball Heroes]] with her unique trait being ice magic. She is referred to as "two-faced" by [[Robelu]], with her cutesy personality being a cover for her crueler one. She is known to bully her allies, especially [[gravy (dragon ball)|Gravy]]. However, [[salsa (dragon ball)|Salsa]] and [[towa (dragon ball)|Towa]] appear to be exempt from her bullying.

[Spoilers] Putine is shown to change her allegiances a lot, depending upon what she gains from them. She is known to have been a wizard alongside [[Demigra]], before betraying him and allying with [[Mechikabura]]. Later on, she allies with the [[time patrol (dragon ball)|Time Patrol]] to prevent Towa from causing the second coming of Mechikabura. [/spoilers]
other_names: プティン(ドラゴンボール)

title: fin_(dragon_ball)
body: Fin is a Majin from [[Dragon Ball Heroes]] and one half of [[Dark Gogeta]]. He was created by [[towa (dragon ball)|Towa]] and gradually evolves from a younger form to much more adult looking form during the course of the Dark Demon Realm arc. While not explicitly stated to be such in canon, fanworks often portray him as an older brother to [[fu (dragon ball)|Fu]].

title: rem_(re:zero)

Rem has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], which usually [[hair over one eye|covers]] one of her [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[red ribbon|red]] or [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[hair ribbon|ribbon]] and [[x hair ornament]] in her hair and the [[Roswaal Mansion Maid Uniform]].

title: low-braided_long_hair
body:
Long or very long lock of hair that has been [[braid|braided]] somewhere in the middle.

The starting point of the braid must be lower than the shoulder (otherwise it's not long hair).

If the starting point of the braid is secured by ribbons or other hair accessories, consider using [[multi-tied hair]].

The opposite of this is [[high-ended braid]].

h4. Examples

* !post #3274500: Low-braided
* !post #402737: Low-tied end with a braid
* !post #3304719: Unable to identify ([[single braid]], do not use either low-tied or braided tags)

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: f8f_bearcat
body:
A single-seat naval fighter introduced in the late 1940s by the US Navy. The Bearcat was a short-winged monoplane with a "bubble canopy":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bubble_canopy and a massive engine. It was armed with 4 .50-caliber [[machine gun|machine guns]] or 20mm cannon.

Like the [[F6F Hellcat]], this aircraft can carry HVARs, Tiny Tims and Several Bombs.

In [[World of Warships]] and [[Azur Lane]], Kearsarge and Halford (Floatplane version) are carrying these aircraft.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Grumman F8F Bearcat":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grumman_F8F_Bearcat

title: heterochromia
body:
Wasei-eigo: odd eye

Refers to a pair of eyes with different colored irises. [b]Heterochromia[/b] comes from the Greek ἕτερος ([i]heteros[/i], different) and χρῶμα ([i]chroma[/i], color).

This tag usually refers to [b]complete heterochromia iridum[/b] (both irises have a different coloration). For subjects with partial heterochromia (different colors are present within the iris of a single eye), use [[multicolored eyes]].

Generally, include any [[tag_group:eyes_tags|eye-color tags]] for each instance. Don't use the [[multicolored eyes]] tag unless one or both individual eyes have more than one color.

h4.See also
* [[Mismatched sclera]]
* [[Mismatched pupils]]
* [[Mismatched irises]]
* [[No heterochromia]]
* [[Tag group:eyes tags]]

h4. External links
* Pixiv Encyclopedia: "オッドアイ":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%AA%E3%83%83%E3%83%89%E3%82%A2%E3%82%A4 (Odd Eye)
* "Heterochromia iridum":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heterochromia_iridum (Wikipedia article)

title: bmp-3
body: A Soviet and Russian Infantry fighting vehicle (IFV). The successor to the BMP-1 and BMP-2. Its main armament was a 100mm 2A70 rifled gun-launcher, and a 30mm 2A72 autocannon. Its machine guns are three 7.62x54mmR PKT. One mounted coaxially, and two mounted on the hull.

title: pengo_(series)
body: A collection of maze-based action video games originally developed and published by [[Sega]], starring a red penguin named Pengo. The original Pengo arcade game was released in 1982, featuring an isometric playfield where the player navigates Pengo through an Antarctic maze, eliminating enemies by sliding ice blocks into them.

title: mejiro_mcqueen_(racehorse)
body:
Real-life racehorse. A JRA Hall of fame inductee and [[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]]'s best friend. He is also known as a successful broodmare sire due to them having great compatibility with [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]]. He is the damsire of [[Dream Journey (racehorse)|]], [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]] and [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]].

His namesake is Steve McQueen, an actor famous in the '60s and the '70s for his many movies involving cars.

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], see [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)]].

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Mejiro McQueen":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mejiro_McQueen]
* "Netkeiba: Mejiro McQueen":[https://en.netkeiba.com/db/horse/1987107235/]
* "JBIS-Search: Mejiro McQueen":[https://www.jbis.jp/horse/0000203356/]

title: symboli_rudolf_(racehorse)
body:
Real-life Japanese thoroughbred racehorse, famous for winning the the Japanese Triple Crown and being the first undefeated Japanese Triple Crown. He was inducted into the Japan Racing Association (JRA) Hall of Fame in 1987.

Rudolf has a predominantly bay coat with a prominent white crescent-shaped facial mark near the top of his head. Three of his legs are completely black starting from the knee down; his left hindleg is black from the upper knee but shifts color to white after the cannon (i.e. the metatarsals. May look like the lower knee or ankle for people unfamiliar with horse anatomy).

[tn]Or, in equivalent humanoid character terms, he has black 'thighhighs' (i.e. "stockings", to use the horse fur pattern terminology) on all four of his legs, plus an additional white ankle "sock" on 'top' for his left hindleg.[/tn]

h4. See also
* [[Symboli Rudolf (Umamusume)]]
** His anthropomorphized, alternate-universe counterpart in [[Umamusume]].

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: Symboli Rudolf":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symboli_Rudolf]
* "Netkeiba: Symboli Rudolf":[https://en.netkeiba.com/db/horse/1981107017/]
* "JBIS-Search: Symboli Rudolf":[https://www.jbis.jp/horse/0000140567/]

title: oguri_cap_(racehorse)
body:
[[Real life|Real-life]] Japanese thoroughbred racehorse, sired by Dancing Cap and inducted into the Japan Racing Association (JRA) Hall of Fame in 1991. Oguri can be considered the most famous racehorse in Japan and was a household name and fan favorite even among people with otherwise zero interest in horse racing.

Oguri has a spotted "dapple grey" coat with visibly darker spots on his rear and flanks. He has a black mane (aging to greyish brown in his later life) and a black tail tipped with brown. There are black "stockings" coloration on both of his hind legs.

The horse was also known under the epithet "The Grey Monster" and had a reputation for having a voracious appetite.

h4. See also

* [[Oguri Cap (Umamusume)]] [tn]Anthropomorphized counterpart in the Umamusume franchise[/tn]

title: fu_hua_(phoenix)
body:
Phoenix is the form for [[Fu Hua]] as she dons a [[china_dress|chinese-themed dress]] with a red and white motif which also changes her hair colour from the original deep blue to a [[silver_hair|silver]] base with [[red_hair|red]] [[streaked_hair|streaks]] and [[gradient_hair|gradient]] red tips.

Her other outfits include:
* Sword and Fire: Black and red Medieval-style chestplate and leggings.
* Fire and Sword: Like Sword and Fire, but white instead of black, as well as her original grey hair and blue eyes.

It is Fu Hua's main/default (and seemly only) form in [[Benghuai Xueyuan]].

title: griffith_(berserk)
body:
[[Griffith (berserk)|]] is the antagonist of [[Berserk]]. A man whose dream is to rule a land of his own, he once led the mercenary company known as the Band of the Hawk, and was once [[Guts (berserk)|]]'s best friend. Now the two men are mortal enemies, and Guts wants more than anything to take vengeance upon Griffith for the events of the Eclipse.

[spoiler]Following the Eclipse, Griffith has become [[Femto (berserk)|]], the fifth member of the God Hand, and has recently reincarnated back on earth as the human Griffith again, with an army of Apostles at his beck and call.[/spoiler]

title: noodle_stopper
body:
A [[figure|figurine]] meant to sit atop an [[cup ramen|instant noodles cup]] to keep the lid closed while waiting for the noodles to soak in hot water.

Only use this tag for [[official art]]s of noodle stopper figurines or depictions related to a noodle stopper's functionalities. Don't use this tag for fanart of such figurines unrelated to noodle stoppers.

title: spindle
body:
Refers to the tool used for spinning fibres into [[yarn]] by hand. Spindles may look like [[spool]]s, but can be told apart by the presence of a hook or thin taper at one end, and how the yarn and presence of at most one disc along its length. They may be used to spin [[wool]], flax, or cotton among other natural and synthetic fibers.

h4. See also

* [[yarn]]
* [[spinning wheel]]
