title: naalbinding
body:
Nålebinding, also known as needle-binding, is a method of making fabric out of where [[yarn]] is knotted together using a specialized [[sewing needle]]. The resulting fabric can resemble [[knitting]], but is structurally distinct.

h4. See also

* [[knitting]]
* [[crochet]]

title: yarn
body: Twisted strands of fiber, often packaged into a spherical shape, used for [[knitting]]. Also used as a common [[toy]] for [[cat]]s. Usually stored in a [[yarn ball]].

title: crochet
body:
A fiber art using yarn where cloth is formed by pulling loops up through previous stitches, creating a thick fabric. Distinguishable from similar crafts by the use of a singular crochet hook. Only tag on finished objects if the individual stitches are clear enough to identify the construction method.

h4. see also

* [[crochet hook]]
* [[yarn]]
* [[knitting]]
* [[naalbinding]]

title: bacteria_(backrooms)
body:
A creature found in Kane Pixel's interpretation of the [[Backrooms (creepypasta)|]]. It is a tall, black, spindly creature that stalks victims of the Backrooms before inevitably chasing them while howling.

The name "Bacteria" comes from a caption in "Kane's Ko-Fi gallery":[https://ko-fi.com/kanepixels/gallery#galleryItemView]. Kane himself has referred to it as "Lifeform Fellow" during "an interview":[https://youtu.be/VIyWp3cNg3M&t=285] and half-jokingly confirmed the term as the official name.

h4. External links

* "The Backrooms (Found Footage)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H4dGpz6cnHo]
* "Interview with Anthony Padilla":[https://youtu.be/VIyWp3cNg3M&t=285] (Timestamped at 4:45)

title: la_pluma_(arknights)
body:
[i]Guard Operator La Pluma, a complete compliance with command.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Rafaela Silva

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Bolívar[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]August 29[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Liberi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]166 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

The adopted daughter of Bolívarian militant [[pancho_salas_(arknights)|Pancho Salas]] and [[Tequila (Arknights)|]]'s sister. Tends to be clingy and submissive to whomever she trusts completely, like towards her father and the [[Doctor (Arknights)|]]. Taciturn and seemingly absent-minded, but an extremely capable and laser-focused fighter. She is also a skilled bartender.

Her callsign means [i]The Feather[/i] in Spanish and her motif is based on crows. Wields a scythe in battle.

One of the main characters in the side story [i]Dossoles Holiday[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Kouno Marika]] (Japanese), and Liu Yilei (Chinese). Her art designer is [[LAL!ROLE]].

h4. Skins
* !post #4679392: Default
* !post #4679398: Elite II
* !post #5575031: [[la pluma (summer flowers) (arknights)|Summer Flowers]]
other_names: ラ・プルマ(アークナイツ)
ラプルーマ(アークナイツ)

title: humus_(arknights)
body:
[i]Waste management expert Humus firmly believes that everyone and everything has a purpose.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]February 20[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Forte[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]185 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]18 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Supervisor of a disposal plant in the Columbian wilderness, he came to Rhodes Island for Oripathy treatment and now works at the Engineering Department as the leading waste disposal consultant.

He excels at recycling any industrial product into fully functional mechanisms and devices. If the product is unsalvageable, he will make sculptures out of them.

His [[voice actor]]s are Kyan Kazuki (Japanese), MinoruK (Chinese), Gabriel Romero (English), and Park Ju-kwang (Korean). His art designer is [[scorpion5050]].
other_names: ヒューマス(アークナイツ)

title: akafuyu_(arknights)
body:
[i]Higashi swordbearer Akafuyu, the Nobukage-ryu disciple.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Higashi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 27[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Ægir[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]176 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]8 Years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A swordswoman that was exiled from Higashi and who got invited by Rhodes Island to become an operator. She has a terrible eyesight, but is a formidable warrior and military leader nonetheless.

Despite her old-school living habits, she hangs out with other operators from Higashi, such as [[Utage (arknights)]] and [[Kirara (arknights)|]]. She follows fashion trends and is very good at video games.

Her motif is based on the Japanese spider crab.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Uchiyama Yumi]] (Japanese), Lu Xiaotong (Chinese), and Kim Yul (Korean). Her art designer is [[Kumatangent]].

h4. Skins
* !post #4496925: Default
* !post #4496926: Elite II
* !post #5645351: [[akafuyu (temperament) (arknights)|Temperament]]
other_names: アカフユ(アークナイツ)

title: free_trial_smp
body:
A very short-lived [[Minecraft]] SMP series created by [[TommyInnit]], in which players are given 30 days to survive, with only a single life.

Artwork based on this series is uncommon, but can often be distinguished based on the presence of a timer somewhere on the characters, a common headcanon among fan artists.

h4. See also
* [[Minecraft YouTube]]

title: afterlife_smp
body:
Modded [[Minecraft]] server that uses the Origins mod. Each character has ten lives and is assigned a random origin/species, which is rerolled upon each death. As a result, each character ends up with numerous forms over the course of the series.

h4. See also
* [[Minecraft YouTube]]
* [[Origins SMP]]
* [[New Life SMP]]

title: sarcastically_surprised_kirk_(meme)
body:
Sarcastically Surprised Kirk refers to a reaction image derived from the 1970s [[Star Trek: The Animated Series|animated series of Star Trek]] where Captain [[James Tiberius Kirk]] puts his hand on his cheek and then covers his mouth in bemusement. The image is typically paired with captions of a sarcastic nature.

title: kung_fu
body:
One of the fighting styles that have developed over the centuries in [[China]], along with wushu. Kung Fu (or Kenpo) focuses on quickly and swiftly defeating the opponents and countering their moves.

Do not apply this tag simply because the known Kung Fu user is present in the image. Only apply this tag if the character is seen performing the Kung Fu technique or stance.

title: mahjong
body:
A game for four players that originated in China. A very popular gambling game in east Asia, comparable to poker in the West. The object is to score points by forming certain combinations of tiles. Mahjong solitaire was widely distributed on computers in the 1980s, leading to some confusion between it and the original multiplayer version.

h4. Related tags

* [[daddycool's tan'yao (meme)|]]
* [[mahjong tile]]
* [[strip mahjong]]
* [[tenbou]]
* [[Washizu Mahjong]]
* [[Minefield Mahjong]]

h4. Yakuman hands

* [[chiihou]] - blessing of man
* [[chuuren poutou]] - nine gates
* [[daisangen]] - big three dragons
* [[daisuushii]] - big four winds
* [[shousuushii]] - small four winds

body:
[i]Perfumer, manager of "Health Garden," will use her fragrant aromatherapy to heal the squad.[/i]

A playable Medic Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Lena

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]

      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]

The hardworking and gentle overseer of Rhodes Island's [i]Convalescence Garden[/i], and resident aromatherapy expert. Her love of nature and outstanding sense of smell gave her the passion and the advantage to pursue a career as a perfumer.

Her regular patients in the garden include her friend [[Nightmare (Arknights)|Gloria]], and the [[Doctor (arknights)|Doctor]].

Her motif is based on fennec foxes.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Takahashi Rie]].

title: list_of_counter:side_characters
body:
List of characters in [[Counter:Side]].

title: montgomery_scott
body:
Montgomery "Scotty" Scott is a fictional character in the science fiction franchise [[Star Trek]]. First portrayed by [[James Doohan]] in [[Star Trek: The Original series]], Scotty also appears in the animated Star Trek series, 10 Star Trek films, the [[Star Trek: The Next Generation]] episode "Relics", and in numerous books, comics, and video games.
[[Simon Pegg]] has assumed the character and appeared in the [[Star Trek (2009)]] and its sequels.

title: pixlriffs_(copper_king)
body:
[[Pixlriffs]]'s character from season 1 of [[Empires SMP]]. He is the king of Pixandria.

He has one of the most varied wardrobes out of any character, having his royal attire, an assassin costume, a Halloween costume, and a [[Wandering Trader (Minecraft)|]] costume. He has [[brown hair]], a [[beard]], and dark [[blue eyes]].

title: zafira
body:
The Wolkenritter's familiar-like companion, a large blue wolf. He is not treated like a familiar but as a companion by the other knights and only responds to Hayate as his mistress. Despite this, he says that he, like a familiar, will help his master regardless of whether it is right or wrong. Zafira is called the Shielding Guardian Beast, though [[Arf]] ([[Fate Testarossa]]'s familiar) claims that this is the same thing as a familiar. He transforms into a muscular dark-skinned man, wearing blue warrior-like clothes created by Hayate, and in battles, always finds himself facing Arf.

He then returns to his dog form as of [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha StrikerS|StrikerS]].

His seiyuu is [[Ichijou Kazuya]].

body:
The robot member of [[Wonderlands x Showtime (project sekai)|]] from [[Project Sekai]].
Based off of [[Mikudayo]], and modeled after [[Kusanagi Nene]].

Was created by [[Kamishiro Rui]] to be used as a replacement for Nene due to her stage fright, but was eventually unneeded in that role and thus given artificial intelligence.

While she originally didn't have an official name, fans started calling her "Mikodayoo" or "Mikodanye" due to her resemblance to [[Mikudayo]], and eventually Miko herself made the "Mikodanye" name official.

title: flying_nimbus
body:
The tag is used for the below:

* 觔斗雲 (Chinese: [i]jindou yun[/i] / Japanese: [i]kinto-un[/i]; lit. "Somersault Cloud")

A "Xian":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xian_%28Taoism%29 magic to ride on [[cloud|clouds]], used by [[Sun Wukong]] in the [[Journey to the West]]. It also refers to the magical cloud itself. In the story, the Monkey King performs somersaults to "charge" magic power into the cloud. In Japanese, it's also written as 金斗雲 or 斤斗雲.

Frequently drawn using [[xiangyun|whorled clouds]].

* 筋斗雲 ([i]kinto'un[/i])

A magical, flying yellow cloud in the [[dragon_ball|Dragon Ball]] franchise, modeled after the original [i]jindou yun[/i]. It only allows people with pure good hearts to ride on it.

h4. See also

* [[sun_wukong|Sun Wukong]]
* [[son goku|Son Goku]]
* Wikipedia article (Chinese): "觔斗雲":https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%A7%94%E6%96%97%E9%9B%B2

title: fg42
body:
The [b]FG42[/b] ([i]Fallschirmjägergewehr 42[/i]) is an selective fire [b][[rifle]][/b] produced in Nazi Germany during World War II. The [[weapon]] was developed for the use of the [[fallschirmjaeger|Fallschirmjäger]] airborne infantry in 1942 and was used in very limited numbers. Firing the full-power 7.92×57mm Mauser round, it is considered as a [[battle rifle]].

It combined the characteristics of a [[light machine gun]], slightly shorter (yet bulkier) than the [[mauser 98|Kar98k]]. The FG42 influenced post-war [[gun|small arms]] design, such as the M60. Semi auto fire uses closed bolt mechanism, while full auto fire uses open-bolt one for better cooling. Magazine insertion is sideways. 

h1. See also
* [[FG42 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h1. External links
* Wikipedia: "FG42":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FG_42]

title: gisela_koch
body:
[[Original]] character by [[erica_(naze1940)]]. She has [[blonde hair]] pulled into a [[ponytail]] with a black ribbon and [[blue eyes]], loves pervitin, and lacks sleep. She is one of four sisters who each cover the four branches of the [[German Army]] during [[World War II]]. She is usually depicted wearing a [[Luftwaffe]] [[Fallschirmjaeger|Fallschirmjäger]] [[military uniform|uniform]], often from 4. Fallschirmjäger-Division. Seems to have rotten luck with parachutes and getting wounded constantly.

h4.See also
* [[Leyna Koch]]

title: paratrooper
body:
A paratrooper is a military parachutist—someone trained to [[parachute]] into a military operation, and usually functioning as part of an airborne force. Military parachutists (troops) and parachutes were first used on a large scale during [[World War II]] for [[soldier|troop]] distribution and transportation.

Use this tag when a character is depicted as a personnel of paratrooper branch of any country's armed forces, while wearing the [[military uniform|uniform]].

h1. See also
* [[Fallschirmjaeger|Fallschirmjäger]]
* [[midair]]
* [[VDV]]
* Wikipedia entry: "Paratrooper":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paratrooper]

title: hiroi_kikuri
body:

She has [[purple eyes|purple]] (sometimes [[@_@|swirly]], otherwise [[ringed eyes|ringed]]) eyes, [[sharp teeth]] and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with a [[single braid|single]] [[hair over shoulder|over the shoulder]] braid [[hair bow|tied]] with a [[black bow]], and [[blunt bangs]]. Her nails are [[nail polish|painted]] [[black nails|black]].

She wears an [[open jacket|open]] [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[black jacket|black]]-and-[[white jacket|white]] [[two-tone jacket]] with a [[medium dress|medium]] [[green dress]] underneath, and [[geta]] shoes. She is often depicted [[drunk]] and [[holding carton|holding a carton]] that contains [[sake]] [[alcohol]]. She [[playing instrument|plays]] a [[yamaha trb|Yamaha TRB1004J]] [[bass guitar]], usually with a [[bachi]].

title: seinfeld
body: Seinfeld is an American television sitcom created by Larry David and [[Jerry Seinfeld]]. It aired on NBC from July 5, 1989, to May 14, 1998, for nine seasons consisting of 180 episodes. The show's ensemble cast stars Seinfeld as a fictionalized version of himself and focuses on his personal life with three of his friends: best friend [[George Costanza]] (Jason Alexander), former girlfriend [[Elaine Benes]] (Julia Louis-Dreyfus), and neighbor from across the hall, [[Cosmo Kramer]] ([[Michael Richards]]).

title: mazinsaga
body:
[b]MazinSaga[/b] is a [[Japan]]ese [[super robot]] manga created by [[Nagai Gou]] and based on the original [[Mazinger Z]]. It is part of the [[mazinger_(series)|Mazinger series]].

It was originally serialized in Shueisha's seinen manga magazine Weekly Young Jump from 1991 to 1992 (with a one-shot chapter also published in the summer 1992 issue of Bears Club Natsunogo), with its chapters collected in three tankōbon volumes. Fushosa republished the series in 1997, and continued it with three additional volumes (totaling six volumes) until 1998. 

The series is unfinished, although Nagai stated in 2007 that it would be resumed in the future.

h4. See also
* [[Z (MazinSaga)]]

body:
[i]"They say there's no [[devil]], [[James_Tiberius_Kirk|Jim]], but there is.... 
RIGHT OUT OF [[HELL]]!!!! 
I SAW IT....!!!!!"[/i] - Starfleet Commodore [[Matt Decker]] of the [[USS Constellation NCC-1017]], describing the [[Doomsday Machine]].

An episode of [[star trek: the original series|the original]] [[Star Trek]] [[science fiction]] TV series from the [[1960s_(style)|60s]].

title: star_trek:_kelvin_timeline
body:
A term for the movie series reboot of [[Star Trek]] from 2009-2016.

The Kelvin timeline, or "alternate universe Trek", is an alternate timeline that diverged from [[Star Trek: The Original Series]] decades before the original series took place, allowing the reboot to tell new stories with the same characters without retconning the original series. The name of the timeline comes from the event that caused the divergence, the destruction of the [i]USS Kelvin[/i].

h4. Films in the series

* [[Star Trek (2009)]]
* [[Star Trek: Into the Darkness]]
* [[Star Trek: Beyond]]

title: doomsday_machine
body:
[quote][i]"They say there's no [[devil]], [[James_Tiberius_Kirk|Jim]], but there is.... 
RIGHT OUT OF [[HELL]]!!!! 
I SAW IT....!!!!!"[/i] - Starfleet Commodore [[Matt Decker]] of the [[USS Constellation NCC-1017]], describing [[the Doomsday Machine]].[/quote]


A very destructive and dangerous [[giant|gigantic]] [[mecha]] from the [[Star Trek]] franchise. It appears in [[Star Trek: The Original Series]].

The [b]Doomsday Machine[/b] is a very powerful and virtually unstoppable automated massive [[alien]] [[robot]] machine capable of destroying entire [[planet]]s using powerful pure anti-proton beams. The machine then uses the planetary debris and other remains as its main source of fuel, making it a self-sustaining robot weapon. 

It resembles a giant mechanical [[worm]] floating in space. Its main superstructure is made of pure neutronium, making it resilient to most forms of energy weaponry.

title: star_trek:_the_original_series
body:
The first in the American [[science fiction]] franchise [[STAR TREK]], created by "Gene Roddenberry":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene_Roddenberry for television, known by the retronym of [b]Star Trek: The Original Series (TOS)[/b] to distinguish the show within the media franchise that it began. 

The show is set in the Milky Way galaxy, circa 2266–2269. It follows the adventures of the starship [[USS Enterprise]] (NCC-1701) and its crew. The ship and crew are led by Captain [[James Tiberius Kirk]] (William Shatner), First Officer and Science Officer [[Spock]] ([[Leonard Nimoy]]), and Chief Medical Officer [[Leonard McCoy]] ([[DeForest Kelley]]).

h4. Notable Episodes

* [[The Doomsday Machine]]

title: yukimura_aguri
body:

[spoiler]She is the one that asked [[Koro-sensei]] to take care of class 3-E, before she dies.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]She has a younger sister called [[Yukimura Akari]], the real identity of [[Kayano Kaede]].[/spoiler]

title: kayano_kaede
body:
The female protagonist of [[Ansatsu Kyoushitsu]], a cheerful girl in Class 3-E, seems to be close with [[Shiota Nagisa]]. She has [[green hair]] styled in a way that [[hair ears|resembles cat ears]] and [[blunt bangs]].

[spoiler]She is actually the younger sister of [[Yukimura Aguri]], named [[Yukimura Akari]]. She used to be a child actress using the stage name Mase Haruna (磨瀬榛名). Misunderstanding that [[Koro-sensei]] killed her sister Aguri, she transferred to Class 3-E under the alias Kayano Kaede using her acting skills, trying to look for the chance of killing Koro-sensei.

It's implied that she and [[Shiota Nagisa]] are together at the end of the manga.[/spoiler]

title: star_trek_(2009)
body:
Star Trek is a 2009 American science fiction action film directed by J. J. Abrams and written by Roberto Orci and Alex Kurtzman. It is the 11th film in the [[Star Trek]] franchise, and is also a reboot that features the main characters of the original Star Trek television series portrayed by a new cast, as the first in the [[star trek: kelvin timeline|rebooted film series]].

The film follows [[James Tiberius Kirk]] (Chris Pine) and [[Spock]] (Zachary Quinto) aboard the USS Enterprise as they combat Nero (Eric Bana), a Romulan from their future who threatens the United Federation of Planets.

h4. See also

* [[Star Trek: Kelvin Timeline]]

title: star_trek:_beyond
body: Star Trek Beyond is a [[2016]] American [[science fiction]] action film directed by Justin Lin, written by [[Simon Pegg]] and Doug Jung, and based on the television series [[Star Trek]] created by Gene Roddenberry. It is the 13th film in the Star Trek franchise and the third installment in the [[star_trek:_kelvin_timeline|reboot series]].

title: unicorn
body:
A mythological white [[horse]] with a [[single horn]] on its forehead.

The unicorn is sometimes a symbol of virginity, as legend tells that the unicorn can only be tamed by a virgin. The unicorn is also a symbol of heraldry in Europe. 

If the horse has both [[wings]] and a [[single horn]], use [[winged unicorn]] instead.

title: baby_i_love_you_daze
body:
A 2018 animated music video made in celebration of [[lotte_(company)|Lotte's]] 70th anniversary. The video is a collaboration between the company and [[bones_(company)|Studio Bones]], using the [[BUMP OF CHICKEN]] song "Shinsekai" as its basis.

The video focused on a middle school boy and a high school girl meeting at a Lotte candy shop, and his attempts to meet her again while anthropomorphic "spirits" of the company's snacks watch and cheer them on.

title: mousse_(arknights)
body:
[i]Mousse, Guard Operator of Rhodes Island, thinks of her enemies as oversized scratching posts.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]August 19[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]154 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]1/2 year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An apprentice baker who got infected and was sent to Rhodes Island for treatment, where she became an operator.

Since contracting Oripathy, she has been visited by mysterious kitties, which are taken care of by many Rhodes Island operators, such as [[Jessica (arknights)|]] and [[Provence (arknights)|]].
[spoiler]Traditional cats do not exist the world of Arknights.[/spoiler]

Her motif is based on the [[nekomata]].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Takamori Natsumi]] (Japanese), Yuqi Zhang (Chinese), Angel Lin (English), and Jo Kyoung-I (Korean). Her art designer is [[Iritoa]].

h4. Skins
* !post #3771802: Default
* !post #3771808: Elite II
